isis.stitle: TRW MANUAL STEERING GEAR - REPAIR - OUTPUT ROLLERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: OUTPUT ROLLERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Inspect output rollershaft assembly bearing and sealing surfaces for wear, pitting or cracks. Inspect for twisted or otherwise damaged serrations. (Bearing surfaces may be lightly polished with a very fine abrasive cloth if necessary.)

Inspect roller teeth for wear or brinneling. The roller must rotate freely without excess lash, or roughness. If a .004 inch (.10 mm) shim or feeler gauge can be inserted between roller and sidewasher, the lash is excessive. Replace output rollershaft assembly if necessary.

svcproc.para: Replace output rollershaft assembly if any of these conditions are in evidence.

note.para: The roller on a service output rollershaft assembly that has had extended "shelf life" may be difficult to rotate by hand initially. Do not reject it. Apply oil liberally to sidewasher areas of roller and assemble output rollershaft assembly into gear assembly. The roller will "free up" when in mesh with worm on initial input shaft rotation and then be rotateable by hand.
